intro: Ilex mesilauensis, commonly known as the Mesilau evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of China, specifically in the Yunnan and Sichuan provinces. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, dark berries that are produced in the fall. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high elevations. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
